result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $2,712.00 entered as ordered by the court on 02/05/16 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 09/01/2020. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Received, signed and filed:
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs.
Forwarded to Sandy Cottrill in the Clerk of Court's Office.

1/19/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 674

Defendant Kevin Dwayne Seward in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Jurors back in court to continue their deliberations.
.
At the hour of 03:10 p.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson, David S.,  brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY AS TO BOTH COUNTS which was then read.    Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.   Court ordered entry of judgment of ACQUITTAL.
Case dismissed.

Defendant Kevin Dwayne Seward in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
Parties are back in court to continue with the trial.
.

Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer, Michelle Anderson.
State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for the Defense:  The defendant, Kevin Seward.  Defense rests.
State and Defense rest.  Testimony closed.
Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  
Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror Ebony C. selected by lot.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:50 a.m. to deliberate in charge of Deputy Sheriffs Rutter and Crespo who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
.
Court released the jurors for the lunch hour.
.

Defendant Kevin Dwayne Seward in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab

Jury back in court. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause and who were duly impaneled and sworn at 01:40 p.m..  
Jury list received and filed.
.
Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  
.
-Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Michelle McCoy Seward.  Exhibits 1 through 5 received and published to the jury.  Exhibit 6 received.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer, Michelle Anderson.  

Court will adjourn for the evening.

Defendant Kevin Dwayne Seward in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Jury trial proceeded.
.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:07 a.m..
  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.
Court will adjourn for the lunch hour and the jurors will be sworn after lunch.
.
Case passed...
.

Defendant Kevin Dwayne Seward in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting an adjournment to obtain an expert witness. The victim in this case is currently on her way to court via train.
Court will grant the adjournment.
.
Amended information filed charging Count 1:  Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm with Intent to Cause Bodily Harm), Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisc. stats. 940.9(2), 939.50(3)(i), 968.075(1); Count 2:  Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisc. stats. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b)
.
As to amended information:
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
.
Case adjourned for another jury trial date in Branch 36.
.
  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Dwayne Seward in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The state is attempting to obtain medical records from the hospital.  The court ordered the district attorney to subpoena the medical records from the hospital.
Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 10/05/2015 at 08:30 a.m.
Court appointed Attorney Domask as counsel. All Conditions from prior appointment on 14CM5008 are transfered to this matter.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michele S.
Court ordered bail transfered from case 14CM5008.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.

Defendant Kevin Dwayne Seward in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Kevin Dwayne Seward in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bench Warrant executed in court in branch 23. Defendant booked and released. Warrant returned to court file.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Kevin Dwayne Seward not in court.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 06-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 6/19/15.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/16/15 @ 1:30pm
